document.title: Main toolbars
document.paragraph:
1Main toolbars At the top of a development window, two toolbars are displayed by default. They are separated by
../10_browsing_tools/10_address_bars/10_main_address_bar.xml the address bar , which contains class and feature fields and buttons to select the current view. The standard toolbar is above the address bar, the project bar below it:
/images/eiffelstudio/browsing_tools/main_toolbars.png
You can hide toolbars (or the address bar) by unselecting them in the Toolbars sub-menu of the View menu or in the context menu that you can get by right-clicking in the empty space on the right of the bars. If you want them to be displayed again, just select them in the Toolbars sub-menu of the View menu.
In the standard toolbar, you will find buttons to manage
../10_browsing_tools/00_introduction.xml tools and windows or that are related to the
../20_editor/00_introduction.xml editor . The complete list of the icons you might see in the standard toolbar is presented in the table below.
Standard toolbar icons.
The project toolbars gathers the buttons for commands related to
../30_compiler/index.xml compilation ,
/tools/eiffelstudio/reference/40_debugger/00_introduction.xml debugging and running . The following table present all the icons you may find in this toolbar.
Project toolbar icons.
Note: For both toolbars, it is possible to choose which buttons are displayed and which ones are not. See the
10_general_interface_mechanisms/30_toolbars_customization.xml Toolbars customization page for more information.
